The University

Human Resources Office offers new services

In developing its strategic objectives, oriented to continuous improvement, a zero paper policy, and the protection of the environment, the Human Resources Office makes an important tool available to all the University’s administrative and teaching personnel. The project was possible thanks to the efforts of the payroll area and the development by the Information and Communications Technology Department.

Masters in Energy Regulation – Virtual mode

Registration opens for the Specialization in Public Services 2020-2021

Law

Registration opens for the Specialization in International Tax Law

Law

Registration opens for new Fintech Law Specialization Program

Due to the specificity of the subject, the country does not currently have a postgraduate program (Specialization or Masters) offering, in its entirety, the interdisciplinary topics the “Fintech Law” postgraduate specialization program seeks to develop.
